metadata.title: PM felicitates GB people on day marking freedom from Dogra rule

content.article_body: LAHORE, Nov 01 (APP):Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif has extended heartfelt congratulations to the people of Gilgit-Baltistan and the entire nation on the day marking Gilgit-Baltistan's freedom from Dogra rule on November 1, 1947. In his message on Saturday, the prime minister said that on November 1, 1947, the brave and patriotic people of Gilgit-Baltistan displayed remarkable courage, unity, and love for the homeland by gaining freedom from the Dogra rule and making the historic decision to become part of Pakistan. He said the day reminds the nation of the great sacrifices, determination, and love for Pakistan that changed the course of the region's history. The prime minister reaffirmed that the federal government was fully committed to development, prosperity, and a better future for the youth of Gilgit-Baltistan. Shehbaz Sharif added that ongoing projects in tourism, energy, infrastructure, and education would serve as milestones in the region's progress and uplift. He stressed that the people of Gilgit-Baltistan would be provided with every opportunity for growth and empowerment so they could play an active role in the national mainstream. "The day calls for renewing our pledge to continue the journey of unity and progress with new energy and passion," the PM stated. Concluding his message, the prime minister prayed that Allah Almighty bless Gilgit-Baltistan and Pakistan with peace, development, and prosperity.
